intro: Pilosella protuberans, commonly known as the hairy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Pilosella protuberans is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
